quest.name: Fly, My Pretties
journal: Honami needs your help with a pest problem.
objectives: Pluck arrowheads from the designated areas.
Open the birdcage and free the house sparrows at the designated area.

dialogue.name: HONAMI
dialogue.text: You have doubtless already taken in the paddy fields that fill Namai. We rice farmers consider our paddies as children. They certainly require just as much attention.

dialogue.name: HONAMI
dialogue.text: There is rarely a day we do not worry about pests or something else that might do our fields harm. If you would like to know more about life in our village, why don't you try helping us tend to our paddies?

dialogue.name: HONAMI
dialogue.text: Speak with my husband, Ageta. I know he will be glad for any help he can get!

dialogue.name: HONAMI
dialogue.text: Speak with my husband, Ageta. I know he will be glad for any help he can get!

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: You would like to help me tend my fields? That sounds fantastic to me! There aren't too many young folk left in the village and rice farming is hard work, let me tell you.

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: Firstly, I would have you remove the arrowheads from my fields. It is a pesky weed that inhibits the growth of rice plants. Come speak with me again once you are done.

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: Speak with me again once you are done plucking the arrowheads from my fields.

dialogue.name: HONAMI
dialogue.text: It feels good to do some work in the fields once in a while, doesn't it?

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: I see you have worked up quite a sweat! Thanks for helping. “Namai” is actually a local term for the arrowhead─it does make you wonder just who thought naming a village after a weed was a good idea.

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: Next we need to deal with any pests that lurk in the paddies. Although, it will not be your job per se─we shall use the house sparrows I have trained for the task.

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: I keep them in this birdcage. Please set them free near my paddy fields.

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: Once they have all flown from the cage, clap your hands. I have trained them to recognize that as their signal to begin working.

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: Clap your hands once all the sparrows have flown from the cage.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Clap near the sparrows to get them to start searching for pests.

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: Thank you so much for all your help! I will not be needing to worry about pests for the time being.

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: I have told my wife to give you some compensation for your troubles. Go on ahead and talk to her; I still have work to take care of here.

dialogue.name: AGETA
dialogue.text: I have told my wife to give you some compensation for your troubles. Go on ahead and talk to her; I still have work to take care of here.

dialogue.name: HONAMI
dialogue.text: Hello again! I do hope the work was not too hard on you.

dialogue.name: HONAMI
dialogue.text: It is not an easy job, but the sense of satisfaction when you are able to taste the very rice you have reaped...words do not do the sensation justice.

dialogue.name: HONAMI
dialogue.text: Harvest is still a long way off, but we are ready to put the work in. All we need is a little help from the weather and things will be fine. Oh my, I almost forgot, here is your payment for today!
